title: Understanding Preference Assessment Methodology Through Iterative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistics and survey methodology
context.additional_context: Social sector education for professional preparation in healthcare, legal, and technical fields. Microlearning content accessible via mobile devices in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain the preference formation process through iterative learning design
Learners can identify at least three bias examples occurring in dual binary-choice survey formats
Learners can judge the impact of anchoring effects on preference evaluation with over 80% accuracy
Learners can apply preference convergence models through learning design to real-world cases
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
